channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8312518] [macos13] setFullScreenWindow() shows black screen on macOS 13 & above
item.description:
macOS 13 starting showing black screen for fullscreen windows, see attachment for reproducer. Issue reproducible on both - x64 and aarch64
Issue seen to occur on macOS versions - 13.3 & above as per our testing so far.
item.summary: [macos13] setFullScreenWindow() shows black screen on macOS 13 & above

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

Changeset: 999e556b
Author: Harshitha Onkar <honkar@openjdk.org>
Date: 2024-01-12 17:56:16 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/999e556be4302de4b6911e6d62ee5ca556a76469

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/17358
Date: 2024-01-10 21:35:57 +0000
Reopening JBS based on feedback received from Apple.

Received suggestions on the Apple TSI support ticket.

1) Raise the windows level slightly, so it's above the system shield window. This was one of potential solutions explored earlier but it was decided that we report to Apple for more clarity and why the functionality changed in macOS 13.3.

int shieldLevel = CGShieldingWindowLevel() + 1;
NSLog(@"shieldLevel %d", shieldLevel);
[window setLevel: (shieldLevel)];

OR

2) Keep the shielding level as-is and bring the window to the foreground after display is captured. This solution works as expected. The 2nd approach is recommended since it ensures that the full screen window has focus as well as being visible.

if (CGDisplayCapture(aID) == kCGErrorSuccess) {
    int shieldLevel = CGShieldingWindowLevel();
    NSLog(@"shieldLevel %d", shieldLevel);
    [window setLevel: (shieldLevel)];
    [window makeKeyAndOrderFront: nil];
Issue reproducible (with both Java test case & native reproducer) on latest macOS version 14.2.
Apple Bug - API issue

Issue reported to Apple as the root cause is CGDisplayCapture() API, it is seen to work correctly on macOS <=13.0.1 and cause black screen on versions 13.3.x & above.

CycleDMImage fails on macOS due to the same reason and should be checked again once a solution/feedback is available from Apple.

Created a native Objective-C reproducer to closely match JDK code and the issue is reproducible locally on 13.3.1 with the native tester. This implies there an issue with native API - but CGShieldingWindowLevel() no longer seems to be the cause, the issue is with CGDisplayCapture() API - when display is captured.

Native reproducer added to attachment section of JBS - main.m

[~serb]
When checking about CGShieldingWindowLevel() in Apple docs, came across CGWindowLevelForKey() & kCGMaximumWindowLevelKey and wanted to discuss if this was a viable solution before reporting it to Apple.
Based on your latest suggestion about kCGMaximumWindowLevelKey, it may not be the ideal solution then and will be reporting it to Apple soon.

Also, setting window level to one more than the present value seems to work too. But you have a valid point too - since this issue is occurring on recent versions and the original code works on older versions (13.0.1 & lesser), reporting to Apple would be good.

            int shieldLevel = CGShieldingWindowLevel();
            window.preFullScreenLevel = [nsWindow level];
            [nsWindow setLevel: (shieldLevel + 1)];
Did you report it to Apple? The usage of kCGMaximumWindowLevelKey may cause some unexpected issues when the window became on top of some other popups/dialogs/screen savers/etc.

Setting window level as
CGWindowLevel shieldLevel = CGWindowLevelForKey(kCGMaximumWindowLevelKey) resolves the issue.
Window level obtained by CGShieldingWindowLevel() is 2147483628 vs kCGMaximumWindowLevelKey
2147483631, which sets the full screen window to the maximum allowed windowLevel value thus making it visible.
It works as expected on macOS 13.3.1, fix needs to be tested on other versions.

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coregraphics/1454084-cgwindowlevelforkey?language=objc
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coregraphics/cgwindowlevelkey?language=objc

Tested out few scenarios -

Issue reproducible with different screen setting - built-in only, external monitor in extended and mirror mode.

The shieldLevel value returned by CGShieldingWindowLevel() is the same for 12.x and 13.x.
shieldLevel value: 2147483628
https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/c27c87786a612501e080222dd8647f94b3b261e6/src/java.desktop/macosx/native/libawt_lwawt/awt/AWTWindow.m#L1697

Replaced CGDisplayCapture(aID) with alternatives to check if it produces different results - CGCaptureAllDisplays() & CGDisplayCaptureWithOptions(aID, kCGCaptureNoFill), they don't work either and a black screen is seen in these cases as well.

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coregraphics/1456259-cgdisplaycapture?language=objc
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coregraphics/1455221-cgcapturealldisplays?language=objc
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/coregraphics/cgcaptureoptions?language=objc

Based on the above observations and as mentioned by [~serb] earlier, there is an issue setting the app window as the topmost window. I tested how other applications respond to full screen mode - (Apple Mail, browser window, IDE), they work fine.

[~serb] Thank you for adding in the details. We are trying to narrow down the macOS version where the issue started. It occurs on 13.3 & above as per our testing so far, we are trying to check if it is reproducible on 13.1.x & 13.2.x.

While debugging I too see the black screen appearing after the execution of native call - nativeEnterFullScreenMode in AWTWindow.m and probably as you suspect the issue might be with z-order of the full screen window set using CGShieldingWindowLevel().

The black screen is caused by the CGDisplayCapture we call here:
https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/c27c87786a612501e080222dd8647f94b3b261e6/src/java.desktop/macosx/native/libawt_lwawt/awt/AWTWindow.m#L1692

Our attempt to make nswindow visible on top of that by using CGShieldingWindowLevel fails for some reason, the window is not visible....
https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/c27c87786a612501e080222dd8647f94b3b261e6/src/java.desktop/macosx/native/libawt_lwawt/awt/AWTWindow.m#L1699
Can we report this to Apple? It seems it start to fail "recently".

FWIW I had reproduced this on x64 mac running 13.4 .. using JDK 17 (!) So I don't see that its a fix we just pushed
I just remembered something Alexander said last week .. about when he problem listed it
It was problem listed already on macos-aarch64 so that explains it.
FWIW the original aarch64 failure is quite different and occurred on older OS versions but only on retina displays
but it sounds now like the black screen problem has superseded it as the main problem.
[~prr] Valid point, I'm looking into CI logs to check when the issue started occurring.
Reproducible on latest GA versions - 1.8.0_381, 11.0.20, 17.0.8, 20.0.2 with macOS 13
We have ~ 6 M1 / M2 macMinis running > 13.0 - so why haven't we been getting lots of sightings of this in CI in the past however many months ?
I have M1(aarch64) with Ventura 13.3.1 and with reproducer i can see the issue in full screen window
Checked a display setting "Displays have separate Spaces" which could be the cause for black screen in full screen mode but that is set correctly on local.
Replicable with the reproducer on macOS 13.3.1 x64 and JDK-22.
